intro: Schefflera prancei, commonly known as the Prance's umbrella tree, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its dense, umbrella-like arrangement of leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange-red berries. Schefflera prancei is typically found in humid, shaded environments within its native habitat. Its unique foliage and ornamental value make it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
